poem:
**Dance of Resilience**

In the rivers of sound,  
Tokimonsta weaves grace—  
a tapestry spun from silence,  
where language once unraveled.  
Hands that hold, release—  
melodies like whispered skies  
carry the heart's echoes.  
Life affirms in beats—  
a friend's farewell, a soft goodbye,  
becomes the pulse that endures,  
a dance upon the brink of light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tokimonsta: Eternal Reverie review – a life-affirming journey through dance music Grammy-nominated American producer Tokimonsta, real name Jennifer Lee, postponed the release of this seventh album, originally due out last autumn, so she could care for her best friend in her final days. It followed Lee’s own health scare – in early 2016 she underwent two brain surgery operations following her diagnosis with Moyamoya disease, briefly losing language and comprehension skills. Music was a solace". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Tokimonsta: Eternal Reverie review – a life-affirming journey through dance music Grammy-nominated American producer Tokimonsta, real name Jennifer Lee, postponed the release of this seventh album, originally due out last autumn, so she could care for her best friend in her final days. It followed Lee’s own health scare – in early 2016 she underwent two brain surgery operations following her diagnosis with Moyamoya disease, briefly losing language and comprehension skills. Music was a solace
